subject: Re: [junit] Method Chains, was Re: Testing private methods
msgSnippet: From: Matt Caswell  ... My experience is different. I ve found that changing my coding style to make it testable (which doesn t
messageBody:
From: "Matt Caswell" <m.caswell@...>
> circumstances. However I think I would be reluctant to change the way my
> code was implemented just so that I could test it, as some of the other

My experience is different. I've found that changing my coding style to make it testable (which doesn't mean just putting in lots of unnecessary accessors) also makes it better. The more I apply this to different targets, such as shell scripts, the more I'm convinced.

Steve
